course.subject: MECH
course.name: Unmanned Aviation Vehicle
course.description: This course will introduce students unmanned aerial vehicles (UAV) that are capable to operate remotely or autonomously in various environments. The knowledge of the mechanics of flight and the design of quadrotors and other types of UAVs will be explored. The topics will be covered include: introducing UAV and its subsystems, developing aviation models, analyzing flight controllers, designing dynamic navigation systems, and planning the operation in complex environments.

reviews.author: 販冰兵
reviews.title: An elective for AE majors
reviews.comment_content:
(1)  Introduction to UAVS: history, components and categories
(2)  Launching and recovery
(3) Control and control system
(4)  Sensors and payload, and UAVs’ functions for communication, sensing and avoidance
(5)  Quadrotors’ mechanics, control, planning, and system design
(6)  UAV regulations, human factors in the system, and legal and ethical issues
(7)  Future UAVs and other unmanned vehicles
reviews.comment_teaching:
Yu Hong Yu is generally kind and friendly to his students. However He has a thick accent and it is sometimes difficult to follow, making his lessons sometimes quite boring.

I sometimes had the impression that his teachings were a bit unorganized (Maybe because he is new or inexperienced) as he would had added addition topics while teaching. He would go quite deep into topics like some matrix calculations so be prepared.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is heavy for this course. Other than having mid-terms and finals, you also have to complete a few homework sets. There are two projects in this course, one group project and one individual project. The individual project required you to do your own research into a selected topic that is probably not covered in lessons. You will have to write a report of 6-10 pages and also do a 10mins (or maybe 15mins, I don't remember xd) presentation on your research topics. The group project  required you to fly a UAV in UST and produce  a beautiful video of 5-6 minutes with voice (e.g. music and so on) to demonstrate the technology capability of drones and skills of drone operation. Then you need to write a short report explaining what capabilities have been demonstrated in the video and at which parts.

reviews.comment_workload:
workload is not that heavy, the assignment may be a bit vague but most of the equations and information can be found either in the lecture (maybe not in the powerpoint, Yu hong yu uses a lot of hand drafts and actual blackboard to teach).
The 2 projects are easy but requires a lot of time. Both are group projects but if you are op enough you can make it an individual project.
Project 1 is based around flying a drone around ust and taking a video.
Project 2 is basically make your own drone and y33t it around a lab, so find yourself some friends. This also has a final presentation for your group to present the result of the drone built, e.g. how good is the control, how stable it is etc.

for a year 3/4 course it has little workload, just need a lot of time for the projects.
